info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued April 10 at 7:08AM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center. ...The Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center in Ketchum Idaho has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING... * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area is HIGH. * WHERE...The Smoky, White Cloud, Boulder, Soldier and Pioneer Mountains, including near Ketchum, Hailey, Bellevue, Carey, Fairfield, Galena Summit and Smiley Creek. The Backcountry Avalanche Warning does not apply to highway avalanche programs or operating ski areas. * WHEN...In effect now through 6 AM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Warm temperatures and nights with weak freezes are saturating a dry snowpack. Large, natural wet snow avalanches are almost certain. Avalanches could impact roadways, trails, and structures in the valley bottom and will be large enough to dam rivers, snap trees, and destroy a wood frame house. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Avoid avalanche terrain. Expect very large, destructive wet avalanches to run long distances and reach the valley floor. Stay off of and out from below steep slopes - slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Slick roofs that still hold snow may produce avalanches large enough to bury a person. The threat of huge, destructive avalanches will peak from about 2 PM to 8 PM MDT. Consult WWW.SAWTOOTHAVALANCHE.COM or WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
